item.title: Looking back at old posts?
item.dc:creator: @daycrawler daycrawler
item.description:
@daycrawler wrote:

[quote=“317guy, post:1, topic:553376”]…________
…,.-’"…~., .............................,.-"..................................."-., .........................,/...............................................":, .....................,?......................................................, .................../...........................................................,} ................./......................................................,:`^`..} .............../...................................................,:"........./ ..............?.....__.........................................:`.........../ ............./__.(....."~-,_..............................,:`........../ .........../(_...."~,_........"~,_....................,:`........_/ ..........{.._$;_......"=,_......."-,_.......,.-~-,},.~";/....} ...........((.....*~_......."=-._......";,,./`..../"............../ ...,,,___.`~,......"~.,....................`.....}............../ ............(....`=-,,.......`........................(......;_,,-" ............/.`~,......`-...................................../ .............`~.*-,.....................................|,./.....,__ ,,_..........}.>-._...................................|..............`=~-, .....`=~-,__......`,................................. ...................`=~-,,.,............................... ................................`:,,...........................`..............__ .....................................`=-,...................,%`>--==
……,-%…`
…,

[left]Now that i got the face palm out of the way, I joined Moparscape when i
was a young age(11 years old With an old account), And for some reason i felt like Google Searching my Signature(Just Don’t Ask)

So after searching for awhile i felt so embarrassed about my younger self trying to release leached server’s or claiming I’m a Pro Programmer? at age 12 Starting a server development page or a team page when i had know clue about anything needed for a server, As well as not being able to spell, Or writing a tutorial on a subject i know nothing about?

I guess my point here is? Has anyone else looked back on really “old” topics and posts and thought did i actually F*cking wright that?
[/left][/quote]

Nope, not at all lol. I fall into that same boat of being from a long, long time ago… I wonder if ReGex or XerXes or any of the other old, old school people are still around…

Yz85Racer:

I’d wager that for the majority of the members here, this forum has been the most stable thing in their life. I know it has been for me, I’ve been here since I was 11 or 12, and I’m almost 22 now… so this community has been regular for me all through high school, uni, etc.

Edit: Damn, I remember you mate lol

Read full topic

item.title: Looking back at old posts?
item.dc:creator: @EcoPS_GM EcoPS GM
item.description:
@EcoPS_GM wrote:

To actually be on topic here - my first “official” post here was this:

[quote=“EcoPS GM, post:3, topic:552145”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=671061.msg4487495#msg4487495 date=1435168868]
[size=18pt]RS Wiki Rework[/size]
The recent work on the Wiki hasn’t been finalised yet, so please be patient while we sort it all out!
[/quote]In regards to this, as I felt unnecessary to create a separate topic therefor, I would like to suggest a syntax highlighter for the Wiki. When browsing through it, I noticed that syntax is not highlighted, yet Mopar itself has a wonderful highlighter. For example, in the 317 login protocol, you’ll find this code:

long encodedUsername = TextUtils.encodeAsBase37Integer(username);
int usernameHash = (int) (encodedUsername >> 16 & 31L);
out.offset = 0;
out.writeByte(14); // Initiate connection type
out.writeByte(usernameHash);
in.queueBytes(2, out.payload);
for (int j = 0; j

(which, by the way, would be unable to compile) and it looks absolutely hideous being unaccented.[/quote]

However, I’m quite new here, so I wouldn’t consider any of my posts to be old.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking back at old posts?
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:13, topic:553376”][quote author=Justin Bieber link=topic=672292.msg4496205#msg4496205 date=1443108387]

did i actually Fcking wright that?
[/quote][quote author=317guy link=topic=672292.msg4496094#msg4496094 date=1442947280]
did i actually Fcking [size=12pt]wright[/size] that?
[/quote][quote author=317guy link=topic=672292.msg4496094#msg4496094 date=1442947280]
did i actually Fcking [size=18pt]wright[/size] that?
[/quote][quote author=317guy link=topic=672292.msg4496094#msg4496094 date=1442947280]
did i actually Fcking[size=24pt] wright [/size]that?
[/quote][quote author=317guy link=topic=672292.msg4496094#msg4496094 date=1442947280]
did i actually F*cking [size=36pt]wright [/size]that?

That is actually funny Spellcheck on android phones, Sometimes a little off :palm:

Spell check is not Grammar check.

wright - a maker or builder.
write - mark (letters, words, or other symbols) on a surface, typically paper, with a pen, pencil, or similar implement.

Both are spelled correctly.
Now you know.
[/quote]wow thanks really informative non-pedantic passive aggressive post

Your not welcome.[/quote]

it’s actually a spelling mistake, not a grammar mistake. try again.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking back at old posts?
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Yes, I’d have to say this forum among others forced me to learn a little better grammar (still not perfect but a lot better than what it was) because of how rude some people were, or the little amount of patience people had at the time for foolish people on the forum (still kind of is like that I suppose).

Basically, to put it short, it was cringe worthy content that I found when I looked back once. I was like 10-11 when I first joined so… yeah.

Read full topic
